title: Pyke's ult is actually the dumbest thing ever
body:
https://youtu.be/yxyFMq3AQ1Q?t=236

The next 3 clips after this timestamp.

I knew this would be a thing when I saw this ability. Come on Riot. An AoE execute from basically half health that teleports him to that location if anyone dies, so he can easily use the reset on anyone who tries to get away.

I'm actually going to just play draft and always ban him. Fuck that.

replies.body: You need to keep saying it, every one does. The damage needs to be straight up halved (base and scaling) and it certainly shouldn't scale with his level.

Ehhhh. 
It scales with level because thats an assassin thing. 
Maybe if it were 0.3bAD instead of what it is now? 

But executes in general make most of reddit and boards salty. I still find people in game who hate on urgots execute too...

An Assassin thing? Since when does assassin's main killing abilties scale with their level and not points put into it? Heck, if you Ult with Zed than then do nothing, you don't even damage your target. :P

Keep in mind at level 15 Pyke's ult will do 525 base damage. Darius' base ult damage at level 15 is 200 (same as level 11), which he has to stack to get to 400. People don't like Darius ult either but imaging one that is n area of effect and higher base damage?

And doesn't require stacking, and is a blink to them, with much longer range, oh and he has mobility and CC as well.

Yeah, they need to take that damage and reduce it maybe 4 fold.  I could see 125-175 base damage at 15, not fucking 525.

> [{quoted}](name=Antergaton,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zH8UuqQq,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2018-05-20T08:22:27.217+0000)

> 
> Keep in mind at level 15 Pyke's ult will do 525 base damage. Darius' base ult damage at level 15 is 200 (same as level 11), which he has to stack to get to 400. People don't like Darius ult either but imaging one that is n area of effect and higher base damage?

Darius' ult doesn't only do 400 at level 15 with max stacks, it does 400+150% AD at max stacks, and he builds like a bruiser. So the question is, should a super tanky champion deal more with an execute than a super squishy champion who cannot gain more max health? Pyke's ult at level 15 would be 525 + 140% AD. Assuming he had around 300 AD that'd be 945 damage. Assuming Darius had 300 AD that'd be 850(not taking into account the 135+150% AD damage from his passive). It's not that huge of a stretch in damage(in fact with Darius' passive it's far more). As for it being AOE, unless you have 5 people right on top of each other you're not gonna be getting any pentakills, and again, if you don't kill anyone in it, or they dodge it, you don't get a reset. Heals will destroy his ultimate.

Yeah, Darius should deal more. Because in order to gret his ult with that anount of damage he has to stack his passive 5 times in a fight or execute someone with Guillotine, hence it's conditional damage and single target. Pyke does tons of damage in an AoE, but he doesn't need to stack it up, at the expense of it being a skillshot and being squishier (but he also has a camouflage with healing passive and a dash+stun, with a ranged Hook as well). 

I main Darius and I'm loving Pyke's design, and I disagree with the OP. Pyke is made to destroy fights or get destroyed, and his ult is fine as it is. Maybe lower his base dmg and make it have more scaling (though being a supp he'll constantly be underlevelled, while his ult passive allows him to get tons of gold, so it would maybe be a buff).

Well counting his passive damage it does deal more, a lot more. Although yeah, sometimes the threshold to kill someone seems rather generous, but at the same time Pyke can die EXTREMELY easily, and his ability to escape situations where he would die is not that great.

Yeah he's something like a diver-assassin. If he doesn't get his job done well and quickly, he's probably already dead.

Now with the Spear of Shojin though... that will be really interesting (coupled with maybe Triumph and DD, although idk if that item is optimal on him neither if it's good paired with SoS).

I left out the scaling on purpose because Darius doesn't build that much AD usually. He gets BC, maybe one other items then fight tank items, Spirit or Deadman's. Let's say he does have BC and Titanic Hydra, that's 80 bonus attack damage his other items are boots and a deadman's at 15 right? So 400, if he gets all the stacks, plus 120, so 520, plus passive damage in that time, so 5 stacks, at 15 is 135 plus 150% bAD, so 250. Of course not all that 250 will be used if he actually ults. :P Plus his passive is physical damage so you can get armour against it.

Now Pyke, at 15, he can't build HP so let's say he 'supporting' and has a Remnant of Ascent which is 350 HP, that's 25 bAD, then he had Duskblade and Youmuu's, so another 110 bAD, 135 total. At 15 that's 525 plus 189, 714 damage.... meaning anyone below 700 HP is dead. No stacking up there, run in with W, press R before people see you and win. Darius can't do that. Imagine if he could, if he does it's only 200 plus 75% bAD which isn't much.

But I do like people talking about this, it shows the Ult has contention from both sides. We already have compiled PBE videos of the examples above but as we know, Riot doesn't use the PBE for balancing but for bug testing (Remember AP Galio? ). We won't see what happens until he's released... and then gets nerfed. :P

It's much easier to use his ult 5 times dead on than it is to attempt to hit multiple people between them.

I only count missing as in they don't hit their target.  Yes, there is a difference between people who can reliably hit other people in addition to their target, but straight up missing entirely I haven't seen yet.

I mean even in Richboi Redmercy's latest video with the black cleavers the enemy zed ulted to dodge the pyke ult almost every single time so it is definitely possible to miss especially considering ANY dash or blink can dodge you out of it since it DOES have a fairly long cast time unless your reaction speed is absolute garbage.

Honestly, I think the issue is no one knows how to play on the PBE.  I haven't missed a single Pyke ult, but then again, I've yet to fight someone as him who has a brain.  I mean, I was  legit matched with ADCs getting less CS than minutes gone by.

There is nothing healthy about an ability designed specifically to snowball a teamfight into a pentakill by executing while dealing AoE damage and repositioning the user.

The problem with this ability is the designer thought "I want to make a tool that gives you pentakills"

Because it doesnt matter? Pike might get AD for HP, but he cant raise his max HP with bonus HP like everyone else can. That is a HUGE thing, and it means that pike when behind will be in a famine state... Unless his ult is a threshold execute, which makes him viable at all stages from all points of famine. 
Further, pike is melee and has few ways to escape damage. His W has a large camo radius and his E is his only actually useful mobility tool (and is only really useful to escape after being caught or to run over walls from something). His ult isnt like zed, talons, or ekkos; using it to escape is a bad idea due to its cooldown and important to his kit. Its kind of hard to assassinate someone with his Q and E.

His health to AD ratio is 14 health to 1AD; Cleaver gives him 29 or so bonus AD (bringing it up to about 69AD from 40). Cost wise, its still the same. 
Pike does not get oodles of bonus AD, he gets 3.5g worth of AD per 3.5g worth of health. Which is around 7% by the way.  
Most of the health items he gets will come out to be about the same as similarly priced AD items(cleaver for example is 3000g for 69 AD; only 14AD more than duskblade which is 55AD). 

Anyway, his ult numbers do need some changes. His maximum should be 300 or so, and his scaling should be around 0.8 bAD; As it is, it DOES have very high numbers. But we also need to realize that theres a very fine line between an ultimate feeling like an ultimate and feeling like a regular ability with a super long cool down.

Raising his max hp is like raising Zed's max hp... it doesn't help him. Raising his AD is the only correct choice. So they opened up more items to him for that purpose with this passive. He'd never want HP unless they nerf his base HP significantly.
So what you're saying is, it's fair for a champion to still get pentakills while behind? LOL good one.

Wow some of them were still at 50% health, that's dumb.
He was pretty fed in all those videos.  Still probably a bit strong, but it is also almost all his damage.

I haven't played with/ against it personally, but here are my thoughts about the clips.
1.  They were all standing on top of each other, usually a bad idea vs strong aoe abilities.
2.  He was a much higher level than their team... his ult scales off levels, and levels are something that is usually in short supply for a support champion.
3.  This is PBE.  If the player was playing  against people at his own level, I doubt he would be this ahead in a lane match up due to the lack of damage in the rest of his kit.
4.  Will have to play him personally to see if he is actually too strong imo.

In the first two clips, they had no tank.

In the third clip, they had ONE tank and he was already low.

In all three, Pyke was very fed. This is helped by how they're playing on PBE, and are leagues better than their opponents.

Pyke is good, and maybe Spear of Shojin will make him OP, but he's pretty balanced himself.

fed pyke played by pros against probably bronze players (mmr is not factored into match making on the PBE).

I doubt VERY much that he'll look like this in most games.

If it's a real concern they'll nerf it.

You can probably find a lot of posts making this argument about pre-release Zoe, or AP Galio, etc... because when it comes to the PBE, the best footage is always from good players stomping noobs.

There are certain things that, if you are experienced at the game, and you are looking at it impartially, you know it's fundamentally broken regardless of the skill gap of the players involved. This is absolutely 100% one of those things.

AP Galio lasted what? 48 hours? 72 hours? Also, release Zoe had a learning curve which caused her to start off at a 35% WR for almost the first 2 weeks and causing people to think of her as being a troll pick. Not a good example.

I'm not saying he might not release a little strong, but what I am saying is that it's won't look THIS bad in your personal games unless you feed relentlessly.

and again, they'll nerf it if it's REALLY bad. We almost always get a hotfix a day or so after release with recent champs and champ updates. Let your concerns be known, but know that this game is in a constant state of flux in terms of balance. Things will get to where they need to be.

My prediction: They will release him with his current numbers (LOL) and he will be broken as fuck. They will either hotfix or nerf him on the next patch. If they don't gut his ult he will still be broken. Eventually they will be like ok we have to gut that ult. They will nerf his ult enough and it will be useless because it's the most feast or famine ability ever conceived.

Once it's nerfed enough to be not OP it will be useless. The only way it's useful is if it's OP. There will be no middle ground for this ability.

Oh man, it's almost like people who play this game professionally will be well above the curve when a champion comes out, play them, do well, and get a bunch of people who don't understand that a streamer/pro-player is NOT representative of the entire player base to scream and whine and complain about how br0k3n they will be.

Every single one of those kills he got were going to die anyway. He's not gonna be that good. Calm down.
